title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 point(s) maximum

1 point is earned for the correct Ksp expression and indication that the two ions have equal concentrations.

Ksp = [Ag+][Cl-]

Let x = [Ag+] = [Cl-]

1 point is earned for correct calculation of the value of [Ag+].

Then  1.8 × 10 − 10   =   ( x ) ( x )   ⇒   x   =   1.8 × 10 − 10

x = [Ag+] = 1.3 x 10-5 M

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 point(s) maximum

Part (i)

1 point is earned for the correct answer with supporting work.

1.8 x 10-10 = [Ag+] x (0.54) ⇒ [Ag+] = 3.3 x 10-10 M

Part (ii)

1 point is earned for a correct explanation

An increased [Cl- ] will decrease the solubility of AgCl(s) since the Ksp is a product of the [Ag+] and [Cl-]. (This is an example of the common ion effect.)
